gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: EPA Office of Water (OW): Clean Watersheds Needs Survey NHDPlus Indexed Dataset

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: US Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Water

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Clean Watersheds Needs Survey (CWNS) is a comprehensive assessment of the capital needs to the water quality goals set in the Clean Water Act. Every four years, the states and EPA collect information about publicly owned wastewater collection and treatment facilities, storm water and combined sewer overflows control facilities, nonpoint source (NPS) pollution control projects, decentralized wastewater management and estuary management projects. Information collected about these facilities and projects includes estimated needs, including costs and technical information, to address a water quality or water-related public health problems; location and contact information for facilities and projects; facility populations served; flow, effluent, and unit process information and NPS best management practices. This information is used by EPA to document national needs in a report to Congress. The report provides Congress, as well as state legislatures, with information to assist their budgeting efforts. The data is also used to help measure environmental progress, contribute to academic research, provide information to the public and help local and state governments implement water quality programs.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This dataset contains information on Clean Watersheds Needs Survey events that have been indexed to the National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) Reach Address Database (RAD). The National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) is a database that interconnects and uniquely identifies the millions of stream segments or reaches that comprise the Nations' surface water drainage system. The NHD provides a national framework for assigning reach addresses to water quality related entities. Reach addresses establish the locations of these entities relative to one another within the NHD surface water drainage network. The assignment of reach addresses is accomplished through a process known as reach indexing.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: No warranty, expressed or implied is made with regard to the accuracy of these data, and no liability is assumed by the U.S. Government in general or the U.S. Census Bureau in specific as to the spatial or attribute accuracy of the data. The act of distribution shall not constitute any such warranty and no responsibility is assumed by the U.S. government in the use of these files. The boundary information in the TIGER/Line Shapefiles is for statistical data collection and tabulation purposes only; their depiction and designation for statistical purposes do not constitute a determination of jurisdictional authority or rights of ownership or entitlement and they are not legal land descriptions.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Use Constraints: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: This is an EPA-produced data set. Additional information regarding this data set is available at: http://www.epa.gov/cwns/

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: These spatial files represent the most up-to-date publicly available Water program data by State or arbitrary region from the Reach Address Database (RAD).

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: See NHDPlus documentation for information on positional accuracy.
See NHDPlus documentation for information on positional accuracy.

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: This lineage was generated by the FGDC CSDGM to 19139 transformation

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Source dataset processed using WATERS Event Indexing Service (http://www.epa.gov/waters/geoservices/docs/event_indexing_service.html).
Record level RAD metadata for indexed results created.
Indexing results returned to CWNS stakeholders for final approval.
Indexed CWNS data loaded into the Reach Address Database (http://www.epa.gov/waters/doc/rad/index.html) using RAD Event Maintenance Procedures.
Final Quality Assurance checks run on all indexed information.
Source Contribution: 2008 CWNS data extracted from the EPA CWNS system.Source Type: offline resource
